alert.note: Alert for Mason; McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 10:15PM CDT until June 13 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Northeast Mason, Southeast McCulloch and Southwest San Saba. * WHEN...Until midnight CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1011 PM CDT, Thunderstorms have moved east of advisory. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain earlier fell from Voca to Katemcy to Pontotoc to 5 miles north of Loyal Valley. Localized road and street flooding will remain possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mason, Fredonia, Voca, Pontotoc, Katemcy, Camp San Saba, Art, Camp Air, Grit and Koockville. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1851 crossing Tiger Creek, Katemcy crossing, Spy Rock crossing, Oak Grove crossing, Old Union crossing San Fernando Creek, Behrens School crossing Comanche Creek, Old Katemcy Mason crossing Comanche Creek, Vater crossing Hasse Creek, Old Pontotoc crossing Little Willow Creek and Old Union crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
